  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BackgroundRunnable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class TypeTwoTask
extends BaseBackgroundRunnable
    This class demonstrates minimalistic example in which there is only required "Execution time Interval" property which requires special parsing

      • getTaskExecutionInterval

        public TimeInterval getTaskExecutionInterval()
        Returns:
        TimeInterval that specifies how often the Task should be run

      • setParamValue

        public void setParamValue(TimeInterval value,
                          java.lang.String property)
        Description copied from interface: BackgroundRunnable
        This method is a general setter method for all properties that hold TimeInterval value. It should be implemented by user defined class implementing this interface. See source code for classes TypeOneTask and TypeTwoTask where one provide complex example in which there are other properties besides Task Execution Interval and second that demonstrates a minimalistic implementation
        Parameters:
        value - TimeInterval value for the property
        property - name of the property to be set
